metadata.name: Potential Defense Evasion Via Right-to-Left Override
metadata.comment: Detects the presence of the "u202+E" character, which causes a terminal, browser, or operating system to render text in a right-to-left sequence. This is used as an obfuscation and masquerading techniques.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('‮')))

output.summary: Detects the presence of the "u202+E" character, which causes a terminal, browser, or operating system to render text in a right-to-left sequence. This is used as an obfuscation and masquerading techniques.

metadata.objective: False positive: Commandlines that contains scriptures such as arabic or hebrew might make use of this character References: https://redcanary.com/blog/right-to-left-override/, https://www.malwarebytes.com/blog/news/2014/01/the-rtlo-method, https://unicode-explorer.com/c/202E
